>> From: Jeff Grigg
>> Something I've done to switch banks of tests on and off is to
>> have them all inherit from a new class that is a child of
>> TestCase, and then I can override 'run(...)', 'runBare()' [...]

--- "Cedric Beust" <cbeust@g...> wrote:
> Annotations enable a cleaner way to do this:  class-scoped
> annotations.

[method level]
>   @Test(groups = { "a", "b"})
>   public void f1() {
>   }

[class level]
> @Test(groups = {"a", "b"}) 
> public class Test1 {
>   [...]
> }

Sounds like it would be nice to be able to filter test classes, 
while Test Collectors are running, and/or filter methods, typically 
collected by the TestSuite class.  This could be driven by naming 
standards (JUnit 3), annotations (JUnit 4), or configuration test 
code (Jason Rogers' messages).  One might want to skip classes or 
methods, or treat them as "@ignored".
